meanings.definition: To surpass in talking or conversation.
meanings.sent1: During the debate, Sarah outtalks all her opponents with her strong arguments.
meanings.sent2: She always outtalks her friends during their phone calls.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Tom outtalks everyone with his funny stories.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm outtalks any doubts that may arise.
meanings.sent5: His passion for the topic outtalks any other distractions in the room.

meanings.definition: To talk more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: In class discussions, Alex outtalks his classmates by sharing many ideas.
meanings.sent2: He tends to outtalk his siblings when they have family gatherings.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, she playfully outtalks her colleagues to make a point.
meanings.sent4: His excitement outtalks any reservations he may have had.
meanings.sent5: Her chatter outtalks the silence in the room.
